treadmillWithDb

Class mySQLEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • treadmillWithDb.mySQLEngine

  • public class mySQLEngine
extends java.lang.Object
    Steps for mySQL/Java usage:

    1. Download mySQL and install
    2. Configure a mysql server instance as part of install process
    3. In the mysql administrator tool you can create a database (catalogue/schema)
    4. Generate the appropriate tables using mySQL administrator tool or straight SQL queries
    5. Download the JDBC driver for mySQL (Connector/J) and extract the archive
    6. Inside that archive there is a jar file like mysql-connector-java-5.1.X-bin.jar. Add this to the eclipse build path by right clicking on your project and going to "build path" and then to "add external archive".
    7. If you are using a standard text editor you will have to add its location to the classpath
    8. Now you can use the JDBC API calls as illustrated below.

    The mySQLEngine class is a class that uses Connector/J classes to simplify database access and manipulation by using only a subset of the functionality of the sql classes for common tasks that are available through easy to use methods.

    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Simon Mcloughlin

    • Method Detail

      • connnect

        public void connnect()
        Method to establish a database connection, reads the database URL and port number from a properties file to prevent having to recompile code. Note: most of the J/Connector methods throw exceptions.

      • closeConnection

        public void closeConnection()
        Method to close connection to a Database, always close connections when done.

      • executeQuery

        public java.sql.ResultSet executeQuery(java.lang.String sqlStatement)
                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        Method to execute an SQL query and return results as a ResultSetobject. An SQL result set is a set of rows from a database,as well as meta-information about the query such as the column names, and the types and sizes of each column.
        Parameters:
        sqlStatement - The statement or query string to be executed.
        Returns:
        The ResultSet of the query, i.e. the rows of data and related metadata.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - SQLExceptions maybe generated within by communicating with the DB, these are caught and thrown to the calling class.

      • insertQuery

        public void insertQuery(java.lang.String sqlStatement)
                 throws java.sql.SQLException
        A method to execute an sql statement which has been passed as a string used in this case to inset a row of data in the patient table
        Parameters:
        sqlStatement - The sql statement to be executed
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
